data.title: Hamilton Library NEW!!! Lasting Legacies & FC Athletic Legacy
data.meta_description: Two new digital collections are now available, Lasting Legacies: “FC Spirit of Community” and Destination Indiana: FC Athletic Legacy. Coinciding with the bicentennial of Franklin, Indiana in Johnson County, class of 2024 student researchers Maxwell Johnson, Josie Lyons, and Jack Sells, launched this collection under the mentorship of Meredith Clark-Wiltz, Professor of History & Honorable Roger D. Branigin Chair in History, and Jessica Mahoney ’96, Director of Library Services & Assessment. Betsy Schmidt ’85, Director of Academic Partnerships, provided administrative support for this project. This project was supported by the CIC Humanities Research for the Public Good Initiative and the CEA Faculty Fellows Grant. Community partners at the Indiana Historical Society, Johnson County Museum of History, and the Private Academic Library Network of Indiana provided direction, technical support, and resources. Highlighted in the Collection’s debut are the legacies of: Arthur Henry Wilson, Class of 1902 Honorable Roger Douglass Branigin, Class of 1923 Robert Wise, Class of 1936 Ruth Ann Doub Callon, Class of 1952 Robert “Chip” Harrod, Class of 1970 Virginia “Jenny” Johnson-Kappes, Class of 1972 Joseph Beam, Class of 1976 Judi Warren, Class of 1980 Pastor Douglas W. Gray, Friend of the College
data.text:
Two new digital collections are now available, Lasting Legacies: “FC Spirit of Community” and Destination Indiana: FC Athletic Legacy.

Coinciding with the bicentennial of Franklin, Indiana in Johnson County, class of 2024 student researchers Maxwell Johnson, Josie Lyons, and Jack Sells, launched this collection under the mentorship of Meredith Clark-Wiltz, Professor of History & Honorable Roger D. Branigin Chair in History, and Jessica Mahoney ’96, Director of Library Services & Assessment. Betsy Schmidt ’85, Director of Academic Partnerships, provided administrative support for this project.

This project was supported by the CIC Humanities Research for the Public Good Initiative and the CEA Faculty Fellows Grant. Community partners at the Indiana Historical Society, Johnson County Museum of History, and the Private Academic Library Network of Indiana provided direction, technical support, and resources.

Highlighted in the Collection’s debut are the legacies of:
